Introduction.Name: Daemons of Chaos
Introduction.Annotation: The Daemons of Chaos, known also as the Legions of Chaos, the Arch-Enemy, the Great Beast, or simply just Daemons (not to be confused with other kinds of daemons) are malevolent, otherwordly entities born from the deepest and darkest emotions of all mortal creatures. From their fortresses and palaces within this Realm of Chaos, these entities watch with envious eyes towards the mortal kingdoms, waiting with unblinking patience for their chance to wreak destruction and dismay upon the world and to feed upon the misery that they have wrought.\n\nOf the many forces which permeate the world, both emotional and natural otherwise, there are but only Four which holds supreme power within this plane of unnatural existence. Power/Anger, Lust/Pleasure, Death/Despair and Change/Hope are the four greatest forces which have enthralled the world in its grip, for in a world engulfed in such amounts of war, corruption and disease, their dark presence and their malign influence is all but inevitable, for these dark emotions and thoughts fuel the main four Gods of Chaos, Khorne the Blood God, Slaanesh the Dark Prince, Nurgle the Plaguefather and Tzeentch the Changer of Ways.

Artefact.Name: Aura of Disruption
Artefact.Rule: Any dispel attempt you make while this model is on the table recieves one extra 'free' dispel dice
Artefact.Description: Any dispel attempt you make while this model is on the table recieves one extra 'free' dispel dice.

Artefact.Name: Sorcerous Lodestone
Artefact.Rule: Whenever a spell is successfully cast by any Wizard, roll a D6 - this Daemon regains a Wound lost earlier in the battie on a roll of 5+
Artefact.Description: Whenever a spell is successfully cast by any Wizard, roll a D6 - this Daemon regains a Wound lost earlier in the battie on a roll of 5+. Whenever a spell is miscast by any Wizard, the Daemon instead suffers a Wound on a roll of 4+.

Artefact.Name: Bringer of the Swarm
Artefact.Rule: At the end of every Close Combat phase in which the Daemon causes one or more unsaved Wounds, a unit of Chaos Furies is created within 6"
Artefact.Description: At the end of every Close Combat phase in which the Daemon causes one or more unsaved Wounds, a unit of Chaos Furies is created. The unit consists of one Chaos Fury for every unsaved Wound caused. The unit must be placed wholly within 6" of the Daemon and cannot be placed with 1" of another unit or impassable terrain. If any model cannot be placed because there isn't enough room, or you do not have sufficient models, it is lost. Units created in this way do not award victory points.

Artefact.Name: Impenetrable Hide
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has +2 Toughness.

Artefact.Name: Massive Might
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has +3 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Unholy Sacrifice
Artefact.Rule: Can choose to lose D3 Wounds at the start of any of your Magic phases and add D3+1 dice to Power pool
Artefact.Description: This Daemon can choose to lose D3 Wounds (with no saves allowed) at the start of any of your Magic phases. If it does so, add D3+1 dice to your power pool

Artefact.Name: Corpulence
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has +1 Wound

Artefact.Name: Incorporeal Strike
Artefact.Description: Armour saves cannot be taken against the Daemon's close combat Attacks

Artefact.Name: Souleater
Artefact.Rule: At the end of any phase in which the Daemon causes one or more unsaved Wounds in close combat, it regains a single lost Wound
Artefact.Description: At the end of any phase in which the Daemon causes one or more unsaved Wounds in close combat, it regains a single lost Wound

Artefact.Name: Unbreakable Skin
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has a 2+ armour save that cannot be improved by any means.

Artefact.Name: Unholy Flurry
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has +2 Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Skill Swallower
Artefact.Rule: Whenever the Daemon slays an enemy character, it immediately increases one characteristic, of your choice, by one point
Artefact.Description: Whenever the Daemon slays an enemy character, it immediately increases one characteristic, of your choice, by one point.

Artefact.Name: Cleaving Blow
Artefact.Description: The Daemon's close combat attacks have the Multiple Wounds (2) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Crushing Mass
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has the Impact Hits (D3) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Dark Blessing
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has a 2+ ward save against the first Wound it suffers in the batde.

Artefact.Name: Noxious Breath
Artefact.Rule: Strength 2 Breath Weapon with no Armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has a Strength 2 Breath Weapon. Armour saves cannot be taken against Wounds caused by this attack.

Artefact.Name: Unnatural Swiftness
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has the Always Strikes First special rule.

Artefact.Name: The Portalglyph
Artefact.Rule: Can choose to keep a single unit in the Realm of Chaos instead of deploying it at the start of the game
Artefact.Description: If your army contains the Portalglyph, you can choose to keep a single unit in the Realm of Chaos instead of deploying it at the start of the game. The Portalglyph can be placed in any of your Remaining Moves sub-phases. If the bearer is slain, he must immediately place the Portalglyph before being removed as a casualty. In either case, place a counter or other suitable marker within 12" of the bearer and scatter it 3D6" (6D6" if he was slain). If the counter ends up off the board, or within 1" of a unit or impassable terrain, alter the scatter distance by the smallest amount possible to ensure the counter is placed 1" before or beyond the obstruction.\n\nOnce the Portalglyph has been placed, the unit in the Realm of Chaos can enter play through the Portalglyph during the Remaining Moves sub-phase of any subsequent friendly turn. When the unit does so, place it facing any direction, provided that: the unit has at least as many files as it has ranks, the rear of the back rank is in base contact with the counter, no model is more than 12" from the counter, and the unit is not within 1" of another unit, impassable terrain or the board edge. The unit can then move normally (but not march).

Artefact.Name: The Rock of Inevitability
Artefact.Rule: One use only: at the end of any Movement phase place a cursed bulwark (an obstacle up to 8" long) anywhere within 6" of the bearer, at the end of each of your turns, roll a D6: on a score of 1-3 nothing happens; on a score of 4-5 place a further cursed bulwark; on a score of 6 place a cursed tower
Artefact.Description: One use only. The bearer of the Rock of Inevitability can use it at the end of any Movement phase. Place a cursed bulwark (an obstacle up to 8" long) anywhere within 6" of the bearer. It cannot be placed on top of (or within 1" of) a unit, or placed on a terrain feature other than a hill. At the end of each of your turns, roll a D6. On a score of 1-3 nothing happens. On a score of 4-5 place a further cursed bulwark. On a score of 6 place a cursed tower (a Citadel Watchtower or another building of similar size). Cursed terrain features placed in this way must be positioned touching an existing cursed terrain feature, and cannot be placed on top of a unit, or a terrain feature other than a hill or forest. If the terrain feature cannot be placed, or you don't have the relevant terrain feature, then nothing is placed. Cursed bulwarks are walls, and cursed towers are buildings. A model from the Forces of Order that is in base contact with either a cursed tower or cursed bulwark suffers a -2 penalty to Initiative.

Artefact.Name: The Eternal Blade
Artefact.Rule: Roll a D3 at the start of each round of combat: the bearer's Weapon Skill, Strength, Initiative and Attacks are increased by this amount until the end of the phase
Artefact.Description: Roll a D3 at the start of each round of combat - the bearer's Weapon Skill, Strength, Initiative and Attacks are increased by this amount until the end of the phase.

Artefact.Name: The Chromatic Tome
Artefact.Rule: Can choose to re-roll the Winds of Magic dice in your turn
Artefact.Description: You can choose to re-roll the Winds of Magic dice in your turn. However, if you do so, your opponent can also re-roll the Winds of Magic dice in his turn, if he wishes. In either case, all of the Winds of Magic dice must be re-rolled.

Artefact.Name: Blade of Blood
Artefact.Description: Attacks made with the Blade of Blood are resolved at +1 Strength. They also have the Killing Blow special rule.

Artefact.Name: Axe of Khorne
Artefact.Rule: +3 Attacks if in base contact three or more enemy models
Artefact.Description: When he attacks with the Axe of Khorne, the wielder receives +3 Attacks if he is in base contact with three or more enemy models.

Artefact.Name: Wand of Whimsy
Artefact.Rule: Whenever the bearer successfully casts or dispels a spell, roll a D6 - the Wand of Whimsy gains a charge on a roll of 5+: The Wand grants the bearer a bonus to both Strength and Attacks equal to the number of charges
Artefact.Description: Whenever the bearer successfully casts or dispels a spell, roll a D6 - the Wand of Whimsy gains a charge on a roll of 5+. The Wand of Whimsy grants the bearer a bonus to both Strength and Attacks equal to the number of charges.

Artefact.Name: Staff of Change
Artefact.Rule: Any character or monster that suffers one or more unsaved Wounds from the Staff of Change must immediately pass a Toughness test or suffer an additional D6 Wounds with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: Any character or monster that suffers one or more unsaved Wounds from the Staff of Change must immediately pass a Toughness test or suffer an additional D6 Wounds with no armour saves allowed. If such a model loses its last Wound to the Staff of Change, it explodes! All models within D6" immediately suffer a single Strength 5 hit.

Artefact.Name: Plague Flail
Artefact.Description: Attacks made with the Plague Flail are resolved at +2 Strength in the first round of combat. Any character or monster that suffers one or more unsaved Wounds from the Plague Flail must immediately pass a Toughness test or suffer another Wound with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Balesword
Artefact.Description: Attacks made with the Balesword have the Poisoned Attacks and Multiple Wounds (D3) special rules.

Artefact.Name: Witstealer Sword
Artefact.Description: Any character or monster that suffers one or more unsaved Wounds from the Witstealer Sword must immediately pass an Initiative test or suffer another Wound with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Lash of Despair
Artefact.Rule: Any character or monster that suffers one or more unsaved Wounds from the Staff of Change must immediately pass a Toughness test or suffer an additional D6 Wounds with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: Magic missle with 12" range, Strength of the bearer and Multiple Shots (2D6)

Artefact.Name: Helm of Discord
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. In addition, at the start of each Close Combat phase, choose an enemy character in base contact with the bearer or his unit. That character must immediately take a Leadership test. If the test is failed, the character succumbs to the helm's sibilant whispers of malice and jealousy. In this Close Combat phase, the victim cannot make attacks and is hit automatically.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Speed
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Speed can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn.

Individual.Rule: While Skarbrand is alive, all units on the table (friendly and enemy) are subject to the rules for Hatred

Arcane.Name: Staff of Tomorrow
Arcane.Rule: May re-roll a single D6 once per player turn

Individual.Rule: Enemy units do not receive combat resolution bonuses for attacking the flank or rear of a Daemon or any unit he has joined
Knows all the spells from the Daemon Lore of Tzeentch
Knows all the spells from the Daemon Lore of Slaanesh

Option.Name: Daemon of Tzeentch
Option.Rule: Re-roll Ward save results of 1
Re-roll Channelling results of 1

Option.Name: Daemons of Khorne
Option.Rule: On a turn in which a model with this special rule makes a successful charge, it has a +1 bonus to its Strength for the rest of the turn

Option.Name: Daemonic Flight
Option.Rule: Fly

Hero.Name: Skulltaker
Hero.Description: Khorne's Champion, Blooded Wanderer, Slayer of Kings

Armour.Name: Brass Collar of Bloody Vengeance
Armour.Rule: Any enemy Wizard that suffers a miscast within 12" takes a Strength 10 hit immediately before the miscast is resolved

Hero.Name: The Blue Scribes
Hero.Description: Azure Arcanologists, Wandering Wizardkin, Tzeentch's Quaestors

Hero.Name: The Changeling
Hero.Description: Azure Arcanologists, Wandering Wizardkin, Tzeentch's Quaestors

Individual.Rule: When a model is slain, place D3+1 Blue Horror
Poisoned Attacks made by this model, and all models in his unit, automatically wound on a To Hit roll of 5+

Hero.Name: The Masque of Slaanesh
Hero.Description: Eternal Dancer, Accursed Maiden, Darkling Deceiver

Option.Name: Lesser Locus of Abjuration
Option.Rule: +1 Magic Resistance

Option.Name: Battle Standard Bearer
Option.Rule: BSB

Option.Name: Lesser Locus of Transmogrification
Option.Rule: When a model is slain, place D3+1 Blue Horror

Option.Name: Greater Locus of Change
Option.Rule: At the start of the turn, roll a D6: this model, and all models in his unit, have a Strength value equal to the result until you roll again

Option.Name: Exalted Locus of Conjuration
Option.Rule: Spells cast by this model, and any models in his unit, are resolved at +1 Strength

Option.Name: Battle Standard Bearer
Option.Rule: BSB

Option.Name: Lesser Locus of Virulence
Option.Rule: Poisoned Attacks made by this model, and all models in his unit, automatically wound on a To Hit roll of 5+

Option.Name: Exalted Locus of Contagion
Option.Rule: If this model, or any model in his unit, scores a 6 To Hit with a Poisoned Attack, the target immediately suffers an additional automatic hit resolved at Strength 4

Option.Name: Battle Standard Bearer
Option.Rule: BSB

Option.Name: Lesser Locus of Grace
Option.Rule: This model, and all models in her unit, automatically pass Dangerous Terrain tests, "Look Out Sir!" tests and characteristic tests (but not Leadership tests)

Option.Name: Greater Locus of Swiftness
Option.Rule: This model, and all models in her unit, have the Always Strikes First special rule

Option.Name: Exalted Locus of Beguilement
Option.Rule: Challenges issued by this model can't be refused, and you (not your opponent) choose which enemy accept; Any enemy in base contact has its Initiative reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 1) until the end of the phase

Option.Name: Battle Standard Bearer
Option.Rule: BSB

Individual.Rule: A unit of Horrors can cast Spells from the Daemon Lore of Tzeentch
Enemy units do not receive combat resolution bonuses for attacking the flank or rear of a Daemon or any unit he has joined

Option.Name: Daemon of Tzeentch
Option.Rule: Re-roll Ward save results of 1
Re-roll Channelling results of 1

Option.Name: Daemons of Khorne
Option.Rule: On a turn in which a model with this special rule makes a successful charge, it has a +1 bonus to its Strength for the rest of the turn
